data.meanings: to be empty, vacant, to finish a thing, cease from, be unoccupied, be free from (other things)
data.sentence: The word فَرَغْتَ comes from the root ف ر غ and is associated with the meanings: to be empty, vacant, to finish a thing, cease from, be unoccupied, be free from (other things)

data.meanings: to fix, raise/setup/establish. nasiba - to use diligence, toil/labour, be instant.
data.sentence: The word فَانْصَبْ comes from the root ن ص ب and is associated with the meanings: to fix, raise/setup/establish. nasiba - to use diligence, toil/labour, be instant.
